intro: Porterandia, commonly known as the desert rose, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often with a branching structure and grayish bark. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including pink, red, and white, and bloom during the dry season. Porterandia is well adapted to hot, dry environments and requires minimal water once established.
